alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Emanuel and east central Johnson Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Blundale, or 11 miles north of Swainsboro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Summertown, Blundale, Three Points and Colemans Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
